author: slive
msg: Please review.
1. Fix the common misconception on the origin of the
name Apache.  See:
http://httpd.apache.org/docs/misc/FAQ.html#name
2. Remove the comments on the hierarchical structure of the
ASF.  Some people (including me) believe that the ASF
should have a flat structure.  And indeed, we seem
to be moving in that direction.
3. Clarify some veto issues.  In httpd land (and I hope elsewhere),
a veto MUST contain a valid technical reason.  In addition a veto
is not overridable by majority vote.  (For the last one, I've
simply removed the comment in case it differs between projects.)
I've removed content that I think is incorrect, but I've tried
not to put any controversial replacement.  For example, I haven't
stated that the ASF is NOT hierarchical.  I've just removed the
claim that it is.
One thing that still makes me uncomfortable is the comments about
the hierarchy of contributors.  Although technically correct,
I prefer to think of our meritocracy not as a hierarchy, but
rather as privelges and responsibilities following from skills
and contributions.  See:
http://www.apache.org/foundation/roles.html

author: slive
msg: Stop the left-hand-menu-creep by shortening
an over-long title.
